t: Mark 13
Destruction of the Temple Predicted
As*p he was going out of the temple, one of his disciples said to him, “Teacher, look! What massive stones! What impressive buildings!”
Jesus*p said to him, “Do*r you*r see*r these*r great*r buildings?*r Not*r one*r stone*r will*r be*r left*r upon*r another -*r all*r will*r be*r thrown*r down.”*r
Signs of the End of the Age
While*p he was sitting on the Mount of Olives across from the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked him privately,
“Tell us, when will these things happen? And what will be the sign when all these things are about to be accomplished?”
Jesus*p told them, “Watch*r out*r that*r no*r one*r deceives*r you.*r
Many*r will*r come*r in*r my*r name,*r saying,*r ‘I*r am*r he,’*r and*r they*r will*r deceive*r many.*r
When*r you*r hear*r of*r wars*r and*r rumors*r of*r wars,*r don’t*r be*r alarmed;*r these*r things*r must*r take*r place,*r but*r it*r is*r not*r yet*r the*r end.*r

For*r nation*r will*r rise*r up*r against*r nation,*r and*r kingdom*r against*r kingdom.*r There*r will*r be*r earthquakes*r in*r various*r places,*r and*r famines.*r These*r are*r the*r beginning*r of*r birth*r pains.*r
Persecutions Predicted

“But*rp you,*r be*r on*r your*r guard!*r They*r will*r hand*r you*r over*r to*r local*r courts,*r and*r you*r will*r be*r flogged*r in*r the*r synagogues.*r You*r will*r stand*r before*r governors*r and*r kings*r because*r of*r me,*r as*r a*r witness*r to*r them.*r
And*r it*r is*r necessary*r that*r the*r gospel*r be*r preached*r to*r all*r nations.*r

So*r when*r they*r arrest*r you*r and*r hand*r you*r over,*r don’t*r worry*r beforehand*r what*r you*r will*r say,*r but*r say*r whatever*r is*r given*r to*r you*r at*r that*r time,*r for*r it*r isn’t*r you*r speaking,*r but*r the*r Holy*r Spirit.*r
“Brother*rp will*r betray*r brother*r to*r death,*r and*r a*r father*r his*r child.*r Children*r will*r rise*r up*r against*r parents*r and*r have*r them*r put*r to*r death.*r
You*r will*r be*r hated*r by*r everyone*r because*r of*r my*r name,*r but*r the*r one*r who*r endures*r to*r the*r end*r will*r be*r saved.*r
The Great Tribulation

“When*rp you*r see*r the*ir abomination*ir of*ir desolation*ir standing*r where*r it*r should*r not*r be”*r (let the reader understand), “then*r those*r in*r Judea*r must*r flee*r to*r the*r mountains.*r
A*r man*r on*r the*r housetop*r must*r not*r come*r down*r or*r go*r in*r to*r get*r anything*r out*r of*r his*r house,*r
and*r a*r man*r in*r the*r field*r must*r not*r go*r back*r to*r get*r his*r coat.*r
Woe*r to*r pregnant*r women*r and*r nursing*r mothers*r in*r those*r days!*r
“Pray*rp it*r won’t*r happen*r in*r winter.*r
For*r those*r will*r be*r days*r of*r tribulation,*r the*r kind*r that*r hasn’t*r been*r from*r the*r beginning*r of*r creation*r until*r now*r and*r never*r will*r be*r again.*r
If*r the*r Lord*r had*r not*r cut*r those*r days*r short,*r no*r one*r would*r be*r saved.*r But*r he*r cut*r those*r days*r short*r for*r the*r sake*r of*r the*r elect,*r whom*r he*r chose.*r
“Then*rp if*r anyone*r tells*r you,*r ‘See,*r here*r is*r the*r Messiah!*r See,*r there! ’*r do*r not*r believe*r it.*r
For*r false*r messiahs*r and*r false*r prophets*r will*r arise*r and*r will*r perform*r signs*r and*r wonders*r to*r lead*r astray,*r if*r possible,*r the*r elect.*r
And*r you*r must*r watch!*r I*r have*r told*r you*r everything*r in*r advance.*r
The Coming of the Son of Man
“But*rp in*r those*r days,*r after*r that*r tribulation:*r The*r sun*r will*r be*r darkened,*r and*r the*r moon*r will*r not*r shed*r its*r light;*r
the*r stars*r will*r be*r falling*r from*r the*r sky,*r and*r the*r powers*r in*r the*r heavens*r will*r be*r shaken.*r
Then*r they*r will*r see*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r coming*r in*r clouds*r with*r great*r power*r and*r glory.*r
He*r will*r send*r out*r the*r angels*r and*r gather*r his*r elect*r from*r the*r four*r winds,*r from*r the*r ends*r of*r the*r earth*r to*r the*r ends*r of*r heaven.*r
The Parable of the Fig Tree
“Learn*rp this*r lesson*r from*r the*r fig*r tree:*r As*r soon*r as*r its*r branch*r becomes*r tender*r and*r sprouts*r leaves,*r you*r know*r that*r summer*r is*r near.*r
In*r the*r same*r way,*r when*r you*r see*r these*r things*r happening,*r recognize*r that*r he*r is*r near -*r at*r the*r door.*r
“Truly*rp I*r tell*r you,*r this*r generation*r will*r certainly*r not*r pass*r away*r until*r all*r these*r things*r take*r place.*r
Heaven*r and*r earth*r will*r pass*r away,*r but*r my*r words*r will*r never*r pass*r away.*r
No One Knows the Day or Hour
“Now*rp concerning*r that*r day*r or*r hour*r no*r one*r knows -*r neither*r the*r angels*r in*r heaven*r nor*r the*r Son*r — but*r only*r the*r Father.*r
“Watch!*rp Be*r alert!*r For*r you*r don’t*r know*r when*r the*r time*r is*r coming.*r

“It*rp is*r like*r a*r man*r on*r a*r journey,*r who*r left*r his*r house,*r gave*r authority*r to*r his*r servants,*r gave*r each*r one*r his*r work,*r and*r commanded*r the*r doorkeeper*r to*r be*r alert.*r

Therefore*r be*r alert,*r since*r you*r don’t*r know*r when*r the*r master*r of*r the*r house*r is*r coming -*r whether*r in*r the*r evening*r or*r at*r midnight*r or*r at*r the*r crowing*r of*r the*r rooster*r or*r early*r in*r the*r morning.*r
Otherwise,*r when*r he*r comes*r suddenly*r he*r might*r find*r you*r sleeping.*r
And*r what*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r I*r say*r to*r everyone:*r Be*r alert!”*r
